pull.title: Fixing env variables/arguments in OpenBSD build instructions
pull.body:
When the `before` version of the commands are executed, `./configure` fails with:

```
 configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
```

However, when the arguments are passed as environment variables rather than arguments (at least on BSD), the `./configure` runs with no issues and the build succeeds.

events.message: Fixing env variables/arguments in OpenBSD build instructions

events.body:
Will try to reproduce this - the last time I tried the OpenBSD build instructions they worked fine for me.

The reason we pass those options as arguments, FWIW, is that configure will remember them when the configuration needs to be regenerated. That avoids problems such as #11657.

Is this problem new in OpenBSD 6.2?
I've tried on 6.1 with my usual configure script, and found no issues;
```bash
./configure --with-gui=no --enable-experimental-asm CC=egcc CXX=eg++ CPP=ecpp BDB_LIBS="-L${BDB_PREFIX}/lib -ldb_cxx-4.8" BDB_CFLAGS="-I${BDB_PREFIX}/include"
```
However I can't try with 6.2 right now.

I am trying on 6.2, I haven't tried on 6.1.

I am familiar with `autoconf` and aware that passing them as command-line arguments should work in theory, I was surprised when it told me ` configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables`. Interestingly enough, feeding them in as environment variables took care of it.
I've reproduced the problem on a new 6.2 install.  The changes to the build commands do seem to fix the issue. This will also close #11868.
Can you please take a look here @theuni? Any idea what could cause this change to be necessary?

This seems to work on OpenBSD 6.2, to build using the built-in clang 4.0 (no need to install any compiler anymore):
```
./configure --disable-wallet CC=cc CXX=c++ CPP=cpp
```
So maybe this is only wallet related?
The `contrib/install_db4.sh` script, unlike configure, very likely doesn't take X=Y pairs for arguments, and the build guide mentions doing that.

issue.title: Improve BSD compatibility of contrib/install_db4.sh
issue.body:
This PR improves the BSD compatibility of the bdb4 installer script.

See #11921, #11868.

I've tested this on OpenBSD 6.2 (clang) and Ubuntu 16.04 (gcc).

This needs testing on OSX at least, ~~and on gcc/Linux to make sure that applying the patch unconditionally doesn't negatively affect gcc~~.

~~NB: this is not yet sufficient to make `install_db4.sh` work on FreeBSD, as we need to use yet another `sha256` tool there. But it's a step in the right direction.~~

### contrib: New clang patch for install_db4

Replace the clang patch with a new and improved version that also fixes the build issues with OpenBSD and FreeBSD's clang, and apply it unconditionally.

Thanks to @fanquake for finding the patch.

### contrib: Make X=Y arguments work in install_db4

Trailing X=Y arguments are supposed to be passed through unchanged to bdb's configure. This was not the case, at least with OpenBSD 6.2's shell.

Fix this by not storing the arguments in a temporary variable but passing "$@" through directly.

### contrib: FreeBSD compatibility in install_db4.sh

Unfortunately, FreeBSD uses yet another syntax for `sha256`.

Support FreeBSD's syntax too. Using `uname` is a bit of a hack but it works and I found no way to distinguish the two.

events.body: See #11945 (which should make these changes unnecessary)
